posts.description: Guardian editor: Time for a ‘new route to the future’ | POLITICO
posts.extended: LONDON — Alan Rusbridger is not coming back. Now it’s time for a “new route to the future,” his successor Katharine Viner told Guardian staff Friday afternoon.

posts.description: By dealing with Amazon and non-news organizations, can The Washington Post ‘blow the top off’ the CMS industry? – Poynter
posts.extended: Shailesh Prakash doesn't want to oversell things. As chief information officer at the Jeff Bezos-owned Washington Post, quality control and customer satisfaction are paramount. Thus, the caution.

posts.description: Why it’s bad that New York is sucking up the podcasting industry | Current
posts.extended: This piece is adapted from my commentary in episode 62 of The Pub, Current’s weekly podcast. Many of my best students, after they graduate, are hoping to work in cities like New York, Washington or Los Angeles.

posts.description: FBI bugged public spaces for years hoping to overhear a few illegal things | Fusion
posts.extended: There is a bonkers legal situation playing out in California. Via the ABA Journal: Federal agents bugged the grounds of three California courthouses without warrants as they sought to gather evidence of claimed bid-rigging in mortgage foreclosure auctions, defense lawyers say.
